title: Maintenance
description: Managing system maintenance activities and personnel

questions.question: Do you perform and document system maintenance?
questions.context: Maintenance activities need to be scheduled, approved, and documented.
questions.examples: Maintenance schedules, work orders, maintenance logs, change tickets
questions.followUp: How is maintenance scheduled? Who approves it? Where is it documented?
questions.discussion: Controlled maintenance ensures systems remain secure during and after maintenance activities. Documentation provides accountability.

questions.question: Do you control maintenance tools and personnel?
questions.context: Maintenance tools and personnel can access sensitive areas and need proper controls.
questions.examples: Tool inventory, personnel vetting, supervised maintenance, tool inspection
questions.followUp: What tools are used? Who performs maintenance? How are they supervised?
questions.discussion: Maintenance tools can introduce vulnerabilities. Personnel need appropriate access controls and supervision.

questions.question: Do you supervise maintenance when personnel don't have required access authorization?
questions.context: Vendors or contractors without clearance need escort and supervision during maintenance.
questions.examples: Escort requirements, supervision procedures, visitor badges, work monitoring
questions.followUp: How are contractors supervised? Who escorts them? What can they access?
questions.discussion: Personnel without required access authorization must be supervised to prevent unauthorized access to CUI or system modifications.

questions.question: Do you control and monitor remote maintenance?
questions.context: Remote maintenance is high-risk and needs extra controls like approval and monitoring.
questions.examples: Remote access approval, session recording, strong authentication, audit logs
questions.followUp: Is remote maintenance allowed? How is it approved? How is it monitored?
questions.discussion: Remote maintenance provides external access to systems. It requires approval, strong authentication, and monitoring.

questions.question: Do you require MFA for remote maintenance?
questions.context: Remote maintenance is high-risk and must use multi-factor authentication.
questions.examples: VPN with MFA, privileged access management, hardware tokens for vendors
questions.followUp: What MFA is required for remote maintenance? Any exceptions? How is it enforced?
questions.discussion: Multi-factor authentication for remote maintenance prevents unauthorized access even if passwords are compromised.
assessmentObjectives: MFA required for all remote maintenance

questions.question: Do you terminate remote sessions when maintenance is complete?
questions.context: Remote maintenance sessions should end immediately when work is done.
questions.examples: Automatic session timeout, manual termination requirement, session monitoring
questions.followUp: How are sessions terminated? Any automatic timeouts? Who verifies termination?
questions.discussion: Terminating maintenance sessions prevents unauthorized access through forgotten or hijacked connections.
